stimulusHtml: In the Annunciation Triptych (Merode Altarpiece), portraits of the work’s patrons were most likely included for which of the following reasons?
choicesHtml: To convey the patrons’ longing for status, by showing them outside the door of the house
To satisfy the patrons’ desire to demonstrate their piety, by including them as part of a sacred scene
To express the patrons’ concern about their sins, suggested by symbols of damnation and punishment in hell
To show the patrons’ desire for greater wealth, by focusing on the depiction of a sumptuous interior
